questions.question: A ladder is placed against a wall making an angle of 60° with the ground. If the foot of the ladder is 4 m away from the wall, what is the height of the ladder on the wall?
From a point 30 m away from the foot of a building, the angle of elevation to the top of the building is 45°. What is the height of the building?
A person standing on the ground observes the top of a tree at an angle of elevation of 60°. If the tree is 10 m tall, how far is the person from the base of the tree?
In a right triangle, if the length of the opposite side is 12 m and the length of the adjacent side is 16 m, what is the value of tan θ?
If a ship is sailing away from a port at a speed of 20 km/h, what is the angle of elevation of the ship from the port after 1 hour if the angle was 30° at the start?
A person standing at a point observes a bird flying at an angle of elevation of 30°. If the bird is 15 m above the ground, how far is the person from the point directly below the bird?
A flagpole is observed from a distance of 50 m at an angle of elevation of 60°. What is the height of the flagpole?
From the top of a 60 m high building, the angle of depression to the foot of a tree is 30°. How tall is the tree?
A ramp is inclined at an angle of 45° to the horizontal. If the height of the ramp is 5 m, what is the length of the ramp?
If a person is 15 m away from a vertical pole and the angle of elevation to the top of the pole is 60°, what is the height of the pole?
In a right triangle, if one angle is 30° and the length of the hypotenuse is 10 m, what is the length of the side opposite to the 30° angle?
What is the height of a tower if the angle of elevation from a point 50 m away from the base of the tower is 60°?
The angle of elevation of a cloud from a point 30 m above a lake is 45°. How far is the cloud from the point?
A kite is flying at a height of 100 m. If the angle of elevation from the ground is 30°, what is the distance from the observer to the point directly below the kite?
If the angle of depression from the top of a tower is 30° and the tower is 40 m high, how far is the observer from the base of the tower?
If the angle of elevation to the top of a building is 60° from a point 50 m away, what is the height of the building?
A tree's shadow is 10 m long when the angle of elevation of the sun is 45°. How tall is the tree?
A person on the ground sees the top of a tower at an angle of elevation of 30°. If the tower is 20 m tall, how far is the person from the base of the tower?
A building is observed from a distance of 100 m at an angle of elevation of 60°. What is the height of the building?
If a man stands 20 m from a tree and looks at the top of the tree at an angle of elevation of 45°, what is the height of the tree?
